result.execSummary:
The defendant Tavone E Newell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Tavone E Newell is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Tavone E Newell was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Tavone E Newell was found guilty of Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(2r).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Notice of right to seek postconviction relief

Court reporter Paige Reardon.  Defendant Tavone E Newell in court.  Attorney Nancy L. Moore in court for Tavone E Newell.  Attorney Carl Jacob Lazarus in court for State of Wisconsin. Rob Csencsics from DCPS in court.Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count(s) 4, 8.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

AMENDMENTS: 

On Motion of the State, the Court DISM Count #1, 2, 3, 5, 6, 7, 9. 

Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT # 4     
Court I/S a sentence of: 
-Serve 180 days in To be served in WPS pursuant to sec. 973.03(2). cc to 19CM3065, 21CF2009, 22CF1186 and cc to count 8


-Stayed for 2 years probation cc to 19CM3065, 21CF2009, 22CF1186 and cc to count 8

COUNT #8     
-serve 42 months in WSP, bifurcated into:
-initial confinement: 18 months
-extended supervision: 24 months
-cc to: 19CM3065, 21CF2009, 22CF1186 and cc to count 4

Challenge Incarceration Program: Eligible
Substance Abuse Program: Eligible

Stayed for 4 years probation cc 19CM3065, 21CF2009, 22CF1186 and cc to count 4


CONDITIONS:

-DNA on file
-Any other conditions DOC may impose

COURT COSTS:
Ct # 4, 8

-All CC, DNA surcharge due on probation
-Bond posted to be returned to poster.


-Days credit if revoked: 55 days

DE advised of post-conviction rights

[Jo W]

Cash bond is set in the amount of $1,000 (per case). $1,000 previously posted. If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _X_ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Alexis J while in custody.
- Defendant shall not be on Lumley Rd in Madison or the 6800 block of East Pass in Madison.
- The Court finds substantial evidence that knowing and malicious prevention or dissuasion of the above victim(s) is reasonably likely to occur. The above conditions of release are hereby ordered pursuant to Sec. 940.47 and Chapter 969.
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor.

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.
Branch 17

Court reporter Claire Stein. Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Nancy L. Moore.  Carl Jacob Lazarus appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State requests counts 3, 7, and 8 be found transactionally related. Atty Moore does not object. Court grants the request and finds counts 3, 7 and 8 transactionally related. Witness H.C. is duly sworn and testifies. State with direct exam. Witness identified the DE. No questions from Atty Moore. Witness excused. Witness L.L. is duly sworn and testifies. State with direct exam. Atty Moore with cross exam. Witness is excused. State moves for bind over, reserve argument for rebuttal. Atty Moore objects to bind over, waives argument. Court finds probable cause and binds this case over to Branch 17. 


*** THIS HEARING WILL BE CONDUCTED IN PERSON AT THE DANE COUNTY COURTHOUSE *** 
*** FAILURE TO APPEAR IN PERSON MAY RESULT IN A BENCH WARRANT OR COURT SANCTION ***


The court may permit the waiver of a preliminary hearing and the arraignment to be by telephone at the request of the defense. A request and waiver form must be filed at least 3 business days before the date scheduled for the hearing. The waiver by phone will take place at the time scheduled for the hearing. Defense counsel is responsible for appearing and providing the Court with the defendants phone number. Failure to appear for court by phone may result in an arrest warrant.  Status conference scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 11:15 am.
